name: 語言與大腦
goals: To learn basics of the brain and the basic concepts and methods in linguistics and cognitive neuroscience
To learn how language is represented in the brain, and how it is processed between the ears and the brain, and between the brain and the mouth/hands.
syllabus:
This course is an introduction to the relationships between language and the brain. You will learn (1) brain basics, (2) language representation and processing, and (3) methods in cognitive neuroscience. You will also explore several topics of current interest.

**LECTURES**

Week 1 Overview of this course

Week 2 Language

Week 3 The human brain

Week 4 Language disorders

Week 5 Neuroimaging methods

**_Week 6 _Neurolinguistics Lab Tour__**

_Week 7_ Language representation

Week 8 Word recognition and production

**_Week 9 _Midterm__**

Week 10 Sentence production and comprehension & **Assign final project groups**

Week 11 Language development & **Submit group project topics**

Week 12 The bilingual brain

Week 13 Language evolution

**GROUP PROJECTS (Details will be given later)**

Week 14 Group project presentations I

Week 15 Group project presentations II

**_Week 16 _Cumulative final exam__**

methodologies.note: There will be a group project.
There will be a lab tour.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
